conversation.content: [confused] What's... what's going on? Why are all these people in our— [gasp loudly] Oh my god. Is this for me? This is— wait, you did this? [shaky voice] I don't understand. I thought you didn't even know when my birthday was. Hell, I thought you barely knew I lived here most days. You're always so quiet when I'm around, and we just do that awkward kitchen shuffle thing where we don't really talk and I just assumed... [pause] God, I feel so stupid now. [emotional] All those times I thought you were ignoring me, were you actually, um... were you actually paying attention? [sniffle] The decorations, the— is that my favorite cake? How did you even know that? [overwhelmed] I mentioned that like once, maybe six months ago when I was drunk and rambling about childhood birthdays. You remembered that? [voice breaking] Nobody's done anything like this for me since I was a kid. My own family doesn't even call anymore. And you— you barely talk to me and somehow you noticed more about me than people I've known for years. [crying while speaking] I'm sorry, I'm being such a mess right now. [laugh] This is the best thing anyone's done for me in... I don't even know how long. Thank you. Really, thank you.

subject: Your flatmate surprising you with a birthday party when you thought they barely noticed you existed
